1�What are you doing here? This is no place for civilians.
1�What are you doing here? This is no place for civilians.
1�What are you doing here? This is no place for civilians.
1�What are you doing here? This is no place for civilians.
1�Greetings. I am 	 of the San d'Orian Provincial Knights.
1�Greetings. I am 	 of the Bastokan Legion.
1�Greetings. I am 	 of the Federation of Windurst.
1�Greetings. I am 	, Campaign Arbiter for the Allied Forces.
1�What can I help you with?Nothing.Performance assessment.New Allied Tags.Temporary items.Union registration.Teleportation.Information on the Allied Campaign.
1�You've already undergone an evaluation for this battle, or had you forgotten?As much as I'd like to, I'm forbidden from providing you with a new set of Allied Taegs until the next battle begins.

�!�I am sorry,  , but your campaign medal has expired. I cannot issue tags to anyone not authorized by the Allied Forces. Return to your nation's capital and speak with a Campaign Evaluation Official.

1�Understood. I shall now judge your performance and award the proper remuneration.
1�Understood. I shall prepare a new set of tags for you now.

1�Complete transaction and return to capital?Yes.No.
1�What would you like to know?Nothing. I'm sorry.About performance assessment.About Allied Tags.About temporary items.About Unions.
1�Anyone wearing Allied Tags while participating in a campaign battle will be judged on their overall performance.
1�Soldiers will be evaluated not only on their fighting skills, but also on how much they contribute to the efforts of their allies through means such as healing and enhancing.
1�However, beware that if you leave the area before being assessed, you will be deemed a deserter and will forfeit all rewards earned that day.
1�Also, while there are no immediate penalties for being knocked out, falling in battle will significantly lower the score given to you.
1�When you are ready to receive compensation for your work on the field, return to me and I shall assess your performance and provide you with your payment.
1�That is all.
1�Allied Tags are a special type of identification given to all participants of Allied Campaign battles.
1�There are benefits, as well as drawbacks, to wearing the tags. One of the benefits is that in the case you are knocked out on the battlefield, you will not lose any experience points.
1�However, some of the drawbacks include the inability to improve skills and earn experience points for individual kills, as well as the right to loot fallen enemies.
1�That is all.
1�Temporary items can be purchased in exchange for Allied Notes.
1�There are several different varieties of items, but they all have one thing in common--they can only be used on the battlefield they were issued.
1�It is highly recommended that you first survey a battle's conditions and then select the supplies that you believe will benefit you most.
1�Please remember that all temporary items you carry on your person will be confiscated in the event that you leave the area.
1�That is all.
1�Oh ho! Keen to join a Union, are we?Very well. Listen up and I shall tell you all you need to know.

1�In order to better coordinate Allied efforts against the beastman menace, we have instituted a system of ad hoc tactical regiments called ??Unions.?? With five units to a battlefield, union registration is open to any proven soldier in possession of Allied Tags.
1�In return for their aid in advancing the war effort, union registrants will be eligible to earn a share of the spoils of war.

1�Needless to say, the choicest rewards will be reserved for those unions which make the greatest contributions in combat.Prove your mettle on the field of battle, and you will earn glory for your union, as well as a sizable bounty of your own.

1�Be forewarned that your commitment to your union comes first and foremost.In the aftermath of battle, you will not be permitted to reap rewards from your individual exploits until your union has distributed its plunder.
1�That is all.
1�Leave the incinerator?Yes.No.
1�Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, ?[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.
1�Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?
1�I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.
1�Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.
1�What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.Red recommendation letter.In a Haze of Glory(pt.1).In a Haze of Glory(pt.2).In a Haze of Glory(pt.3).
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Now, listen close...
1�Have I piqued your interest?Yes!No.
1�Have I piqued your interest?Yes!No.
1�If it is not the ??adventurer??! Had you a change of heart, eh?
1�State your business here, or I shall toss you in the citadel's dungeons and leave you to rot among the corpses.
1�An adventurer, eh? Well, if it is adventure you seek, I may have a means with which you could put your skills to use.
1�That is quite a shame. Now begone before I lose my patience with you.
1�Excellent.If I am not mistaken, the Kingdom is eagerly searching for volunteers to join the Knights of the Iron Ram. Let me pen you a recommendation.
1�One moment, while I fetch a piece of parchment.
1�Take this to the San d'Orian capital and present it to Captain Mainchelite.
s.�Take care, as the journey to the capital will not be an easy one.
1�May the divine light of the Goddess guide you.
1�Take that 3???? to the San d'Orian capital and present it to Captain Mainchelite.
1�If my memory serves me well, I seem to recall an initiation trial was required of all new recruits. Oh, but you need worry not--the assessment was nothing more than formality.
1�Well, congratulations, recruit! I look forward to hearing the bards sing of your heroic deeds!
s.�Take care, as the journey to the capital will not be an easy one.
1�May the divine light of the Goddess guide you.
1�No unauthorized personnel are permit--Oh, it's you again...
1�What? Ya want something?
1�Lemme guess, you wanna get your hands on 6????. Am I right?
1�Fine, I'll see what I can do. Gimme a minute.
1�Well then, stop bothering me! You got no idea what it's like to be this busy.
1�That figures. Looks like we're plumb outta maps.
1�Of all the times...
1�Well, since you're here, I may as well get some use outta ya.
1�Oh, don't gimme that look. Get over yourself. I'll go and get ya your map while you're keeping busy.
1�Ya see, a while ago I made the mistake of putting 6???? in the Firesand Storeroom.
1�I mean, come on. "Firesand" and "Firepower." How am I not supposed to get those mixed up?
1�So look, just go get that and bring it back here for me. And that's it.
1�...What? I said that's it. Go fetch me the 3???? out of the Firesand Storeroom.
1�You get your hands on that 3???? from the Firesand Storeroom yet? I'll have your map ready by the time you bring it back.
e.�Hey, that's the stuff! The 3????, just like I asked. You're alright...for an adventurer.
1�I know I asked you to help me, but truth be told...
1�I checked everywhere I could think of and just couldn't find you a map.
1�...Oh, wait!
e.�...Found one.
1�Heh, guess I had one after all.Here you go, your very own 3????.
.� Heh, who woulda thought, eh?It was here the whole time. Guess I just forgot sticking it on there.Well, say ??thank you.??
1�A number of cases are lined up on the table here.
1�Is he right?Yes, that's exactly what I want.Actually, no.
1�A sign reading "Keep Away From Fire!" is affixed to the cas
1�Rarcasmeault tears the "Keep Away From Fire!" sign from the cas
1�A crude map is drawn on the backside of the sign
1�Hey, hey, hey! You can't be here!How did you get past the guards?

1�After careful deliberation, our military strategists have discerned that the Beastman Confederate's main target is Jeuno.Not that any of us think they will be undertaking any form of structured offensive...
1�What?A group of child knights, you say?
1�Hmm...I know not of the ones you seek, but there are indeed squires, refugees, and even children who have taken residence within this stronghold since the outbreak of the war.
1�Now, have you some manner of documentation identifying you as the guardian of these children?
1�I beg your pardon, Sir Vailanice. Is this person, too, a member of your extended family?
1�Sir Vailanice, if I could be forgiven for my boldness...
1�Are there not more suitable playgrounds than here for the children?
1�That, I deny not, but...
1�Could this be the handiwork of Beastman Confederate elite?
1�At once, sir.And...I mean not to unnerve you, sir, but I sense an ill foreboding. Please, take all care.
1�Hmph...To where have all of you been traipsing?
1�Sir Vailanice would give me a right royal hiding if misfortune were to befall one of his ??relatives.?? Have you no consideration?
1�Hm? Is...something amiss?
1�The Goddess have mercy...Should the gas find its way into one's lungs...
1�Sir, we have a small supply of marshmallow-infused medicine to treat your condition. Allow me to assist--
1�Suspicion, sir?
1�Aaah, yes--the rather sizeable contraption reportedly discovered by a mercenary named Mihke...or thereabouts.
1�It was taken to the number eight shelter and is awaiting inspection. What of it, sir?
1�But, sir, you can barely stand. I will go in your stead, if you will but give the order.
1�Now then, my miniature knights--here is your assignment:
1�You are to head to the storeroom on the upper level and bring back all the dried marshmallows your scrawny little arms can carry. Understood?
1�Curses! That little rascal's sneaked off and followed Sir Vailanice!
1� , is it not? You must go and retrieve the brash young fool this instant.
1�If something unsavory were to happen as a result, I would know not what to say to Sir Vailanice.

1�<Sigh> While I truly appreciate--and I do mean it--your generous offer to run into the thick of danger, I would be even more delighted if you were to go and fetch the dried marshmallows from the storeroom.
1� . This here is the 3????.
1�It is accessible from H-9 on your map. Make haste and you may yet be able to catch up to the rascal.
1�And please, watch out for Sir Vailanice also. While he lacks not for intelligence nor courage, his selflessness often blinds him to certain details.
1�Other units should be in possession of a spare key. I will have one brought here presently, so come and collect it from me in a short while.
1�The spare key, you say? The intruders have cut off many of the passageways within the citadel, so it will take some time yet. Have patience.
1�Take this spare key to the number eight shelter. Be careful not to misplace it again.
1�The number eight shelter is accessible via a secret entrance at H-9 on your map.
1�San d'Oria Nation Quest 6: Follow B.
1�This citadel houses an enormous deposit of firesand. By using it to blast--wait. Who are you!?If you are not authorized to be here then you must leave at once!
1�Have you heard tell of the Gigas invasion of Vunkerl Inlet?
1�Stories tell of their monstrous strength, effortlessly tossing about boulders even larger than themselves.
1�...That reminds me, I haven't acquried a map of Vunkerl Inlet myself.I must go and retrieve one from the Munitions Storeroom.
1�The Firesand Storeroom lies beyond this gate.But be warned, adventurer. The way is rife with danger. Proceed at your own peril.
1�The opening mechanism for the door is out of order.You won't be able to open it for now.

1�Have you seen any of the accursed ??maws,?? as they are being called? The apparitions floating about with those gaping jowls. I heard that in Jeuno they are trying desperately to figure out exactly what they are.
1�Pull yourself together, man! You think you're the only one who's scared? I'm terrified!But if we give in to that fear and run now, we'll have no place left to go!
1�Beastman Confederate or not, if they are going to attack, I wish they would just hurry up and get it over with!I'm sick of being afraid and waiting... I just want it all to be over!

1�I think I'd like to open a restaurant if I ever live to see the end of this war.You may not be able to tell by looking at me now, but I used to train under a real chef.If you ever get the chance, you should try one of my dishes.
1�At the open-sea battle of Zafmlug, the combined naval armada of Tavnazia and Bastok prevented the landfall of the gigas forces.A grand naval battle for the history books, by any reckoning!

1�The Banishing Gates are currently undergoing repairs.Apparently the opening and closing mechanism was too delicate...Luckily, it started malfunctioning in the closed position. Surely a blessing from Altana herself.
1�I am a friar from the San d'Orian Cathedral.

1�I was journeying on my pilgrimage when I inadvertently wandered into the front line of the beasthorde offensive. Fortunately, the Royal Knights discovered me first, and took me into their custody. Even though I am thankful, I wish the knights would grant me leave to continue my journey.
1�I am a friar from the San d'Orian Cathedral.

1�I was journeying on my pilgrimage when I inadvertently wandered into the front line of the beasthorde offensive. Fortunately, the Royal Knights discovered me first, and took me into their custody. Even though I am thankful, I wish the knights would grant me leave to continue my journey.
1�Would you perhaps be a soldier of the Allied Forces? I am in desperate need of your assistance. I beg you, please hear me out.

1�It is a rather embarrassing story... When I was attacked by monsters in Grauberg, in my blind panic I threw whatever was on hand in an attempt to drive away the beasts. It was too late when I realized I had hurled a package of great import, entrusted to me from the Cathedral, straight into the river. I would have retrieved it myself, but I was...uh...distracted.
1�If you were to chance upon an ornate package while traveling through Grauberg, could you please bring it back to me?
1�I pray that it has not been washed downstream. I would be indebted if you could locate the package...and not spread the tale of my ??exploits.??
1�If you were to chance upon an ornate package while traveling through Grauberg, could you please bring it back to me?
1�I pray that it has not been washed downstream. I would be indebted if you could locate the package...and not spread the tale of my ??exploits.??
1�Why, be that not the 3????? That is indeed the item I hurled--I mean, dropped!
1�I thank you from the bottom of my heart. The package contains tools such as paint, to be used to repair the Goddess's image should she be damaged during the course of the war.
1�This is not much, but please accept it. This white magic will allow the user to teleport straight to the battlefield within the blink of an eye.
1�It pains me to wonder what may have become of the cathedral...O merciful Altana! Please grant us your divine protection!
1�Your memory is engraved with an image of your surroundings and the fragrance of flowers.
1�Assist with the fortifications?Show them how it's done!Refuse to help.Ask for an explanation.
1�Choose a crystal!Fire crystal.Ice crystal.Wind crystal.Earth crystal.Lightning crystal.Water crystal.Light crystal.Dark crystal.Plumb give up.
1�I am charged with the provisioning of supplies for our troops out on the battlefield.I can issue you temporary items in exchange for Allied Notes.
1�Let me show you the list of items currently available to you.

' Allied Note?'[/s].
1�Proceed with the transaction?Yes.No.
1�Is there anything else you requir
1�Browse which page?Never mind.Page 1.Page 2.Page 3.Page 4.
1�I am charged with the provisioning of supplies for our troops out on the battlefield.I can issue you temporary items in exchange for Allied Notes.
1�Let me show you the list of items currently available to you.

' Allied Note?'[/s].

1�Browse which page?Never mind.Page 1.Page 2.Page 3.Page 4.
1�How very unlike you to arrive last of all.
1�But, as captain, I appreciate your being here just the same.
1�You'll be pleased to hear that we, the Knights of the Swiftwing Griffin, have been entrusted with a role of great import: the defense of the northeastern quadrant of the Garlaige Citadel!
1�When we were mistakenly thrown into the dungeon upon our arrival here, Chef Rouellouge showed kindness by providing us with scrumptious sausages. We must go to his aid!
1�Agreed. , you must be tired from your journey, but I fear there isn't yet time for rest. Come with us.
1�(Someone's collapsed on the floor...)
1�Thianond!?
1�He's...dead.
1�Quiet...Someone approaches.
1�Sir Vailanice!?
1�B-but, what about you?
1�Sir Vailanice, let us accompany you!
1�Un-understood...
1�Sir Vailanice! Where've you gone!?
1�Huh!? Wh-what are Orcs doing here!?
1�P-prepare yourselves, Orcs!Your opponent is Captain Rahal of the Swiftwing Griffins!
1�Sir Vailanice!
1�B-but, a knight turns not his back from battle! Let me stay and fight beside the two of you!
1�Wh-what!? Um, uh...A knight must, above all else, value honor and courage...a-and when called upon, must take to battle with sword and spear--
1�Sir Vailanice.  .
1�Please be safe!
1�Sir Vailanice!
1�Sir Vailanice!?
1�Sir Vailanice! Hold on, please!
1�Th-this is all my fault... If only I hadn't been so reckless...Please, forgive me...
1�What? Me...?
1�Sir Vailanice...
!!�Captain Rongelouts, sir!
1�Maggots we may be...
1�But...it is the aspiration of these maggots to one day become knights like Sir Vailanice!
1�We will obey your every command! Please, Captain, grant us permission to join the Knights of the Iron Ram!
1�No. Best not raise your hopes, lest they be betrayed.
1�I am without doubt, though, that today we've taken a substantial step towards reaching that goal.
1�Now, first things first--let us hurry home to San d'Oria.
1�Castellan Rholont would not receive us kindly should we return any later than absolutely necessary.
1�Such minor details matter not.Any Orcish force that has the gall to invade the citadel will have to answer to the Swiftwing Griffins!
1�Indeed it is...What shall we do, Captain Rahal?
1�...Uwaaah!
1�(Oh, it's just you,  ... Don't startle me like that.)
1�(Captain, what's the situation?)
1�Wh-what? No...
1�What's wrong?
1�Yes, sir!
1�Please be careful, Sir Vailanice!
1�Um...Captain?Hey, where did he go?
1�We'll come with you,  !
!!�Captain! Now!
1�You did it, Captain!
1�Yeah!
1�Cyra...nuce.The northeastern quadrant--is it not in the jurisdiction of the Swiftwing Griffins?
1�Let's make haste and find Sir Vailanice!
1�(Shhh, Cyra. Keep it down.)
1�Hmph, you always act all high-and-mighty when Sir Vailanice isn't here!
1�But, we, the Knights of the Swiftwing Griffin, will not stand for it! Right, Captain?
1�Darn it!
1�Cyra, we're finally going to become real knights!
1�Hahaha! How could we ever forget about poor Castellan Rholont?
1�Oh? We've met previously, have we not?
1�Yes, I remember now--you are  .
1�Well...in a sense, yes.

1�You must excuse my intrusion the other day.If you'll allow me to properly introduce myself, I am Vailanice of the Knights of the Iron Ram. I've the honor of leading a modest number of knights in the regiment.
1�This would be our first time trading words in earnest, is it not? Truth be told, I've already been privileged with the knowledge of your many exploits.
1�Courtesy of these young knights, here.
1�A rather intriguing development...How does cleaning duty suddenly become defense, pray tell?
1�Hahaha, spoken like a true knight. The visual integrity of the citadel's northeast is in your hands, fearless soldiers.

1�Your concern is appreciated, Diordinne, but a little leeway would be in order, I should think. After all, thanks to their tireless effort, the provisions storehouse is now free of rats and other undesirables.
1�Calm down, man.Tell me what's happened.
1�Kitchen personnel, you say?But, what business have they to wander without the citadel?
1�The kitchen? Why, that's at the heart of the northeastern quadrant currently placed on high alert with no less than doubled guards!
1�Goblins...Bounty hunters, I'm willing to wager. We must get to the bottom of this.
1�Thianond, pray lead the way.
1�Diordinne, you are to relay the news of this disturbing development to all commanding officers and their regiments.
1�Thank you, Diordinne. You also.
1�<Cough, cough>
1�Confound it!Whence is that accursed green smoke...
1�Hm? Children, why are you here?
1�<Cough, splutter>...
1�Approach me not!
1�This area is fraught with danger!Return to the upper level, now!
1�You needn't be concerned with me--I will join you momentarily.Now, leave! This is a direct order from your superior officer!
1�The citadel is under attack!The enemy uses poisonous gas. Thianond...he has been slain.
1�I am fine. There are still those below that are in need of aid, however. They can yet be saved if we make haste.
1�Furthermore, I have a suspicion that requires ascertaining.
1�Recall you the enemy siege engine that was found abandoned at the Meriphataud Mountains?
1�That is the object of my suspicion.It is my wish to inspect it without delay.
1�No. More lives needn't be placed in harm's way. Besides, I require your presence here to inform the others of the situation.
1�Captain Rahal, Swiftwing Griffins.Grateful am I for your selfless offer.
1�Here, however, is where your services are most direly needed.
1�Diordinne is one of my most capable, but this situation may prove to be beyond even one of his caliber. Can I rely upon you all to assist him in any and every way possible?
1�I leave them in your charge, Diordinne.
1�I'm depending on you!
1�Thank you. And you also!
1�Over here!
1� ?But...how is it possible?
1�Never mind, that is not of great import now.I've discovered a rope of Goblin construction hanging from a ventilation shaft in the ceiling here.
1�It is through there that the intruders most likely gained entry. Or perhaps...engineered their escape?
1�Hm? That sound...
1�It's coming from within the Orcish warmachine.
1�By the Goddess...Orcs!
1�They were concealing themselves inside there all this time? Have our engineers knotholes for eyes!?
1�They're speaking in the Orcish tongue...
1�Strategy...Poisonous gas...
1�Zogbog? I recognize that name...
1�Ah, yes, I recall hearing of him from a captive. He's the Orc who has swiftly risen to prominence as a military tactician in the service of Doggvdegg, the infamous leader of the Bloodwing Horde.
1�They intend to release the poisonous gas again...
1�The commander must be informed of this insidious plot without delay.
1�R-Rahal!?Of all the ill-timed entrances...
1�Rahal!
1�<Cough, cough>...
1�Rahal.
1�  and I will keep the enemy at bay.
1�I need you to deliver word to Diordinne and have him organize search parties to ferret out the Goblin mercenaries.
1�Rahal! Tell me--what is the duty of a knight?
1�Wrong!
1�Listen to me, Rahal. The duty of a knight...is being the shield that protects those who cannot defend themselves.
1�Unless the enemy's plot is made known, countless more innocent lives will be lost.
1�Now, go!
1�<Cough, cough>...
1�Forgive me,  .I wished not for you to be involved in this fight.
1�I must confess, I barely have the strength remaining to stay standing.
1�I should at least, however, be able to hold the attention of the Orcs.
1�You must find an opening and destroy the siege engine. It must not be allowed to spread its cloud of death any further.
1�I owe you a debt of gratitude.Young Rahal and the Swiftwing Griffins have an irreplaceable ally in you,  .
1�Now, with me!
1�<Cough, cough>...
1�A magnificent display,  !
1�But...it seems we've reached the end of the road.
1�It has been an honor to fight alongside you... ...
1�R-Rahal, why have you returned?
1�And...the rest of you...
1�Captain Rongelouts!
1�<Puff, wheeze>...
1�Rahal... You are the spitting image of myself in my younger days...
1�When I was but a young squire, my sole desire was to accomplish great feats and prove my worth.
1�But before long, I came to realize that I was only running around in circles, chasing after rainbows...
1�No need for the long face, Rahal...
1�It is for the happiness and smiles of others that a knight fights.Therefore, it is only fitting that he, too, departs with a smile on his face...and peace in his heart.
1�Ha ha ha...
1�That expression...is more...like it...
1�<Pant, pant>...S-Sir Vailanice! We have an emergency! Th-the enemy...!
1�Sir! We're under attack!All kitchen personnel have fallen victim--
1�Sir, all were confirmed to have perished in the kitchen where they stood!
1�On the contrary, sir, eyewitness accounts strongly suggest the involvement of Goblins.
1�At ease, soldier.
1�Foul beastmen. For your craven usage of poisonous gas, you shall receive no quarter from me.Now, brace yourselves, for today, justice will be dealt in tempered steel!
1�...Captain?
1�You presume to address me as your captain?Admitting a squirming swarm of maggots into the Iron Rams is not something I recall doing.
1�Heh... Bold words coming from a maggot.
1�Those words, at least, are reminiscent of Vailanice in his youth...
1�...I shall hear the rest of them back at the capital.
1�But, sir, venerable sir. Eliminating enemy supplies fundamental siege strategy, sir.
1�Master Zogbog, sir. This siege engine poor quality made from scrap parts, sir. You please handle with care, sir.
1�Worry not, sir. Underlings now gone to positions with fumigation device, sir.
-!�Urgh!
1�Grrr! Tell me something I don't know!
1�I'll not tolerate any further blunders! Understood?
1�Only if accomplished without external aid will this operation garner us acclaim. Keep that drilled into your thick skulls!
1�(...Chazgek!)We've been discovered!
1�(Geshdek!)
1�(Veggrok...!)He wasn't alone!
1�Hmm...there's something eerily familiar about that one. But, it couldn't possibly be...
1�...You again!?
1�It seems you've made an annoying habit of foiling my plans...
1�But, not today...and not ever again!
1�Orcs! Make sure your gas masks are securely fastened!
1�Now, go and tear them all limb from limb!
1�Gahahaha! This poisonous gas is a special recipe I learned directly from the Moblins. It's quite a rare treat, so be sure to waste not even a single whiff!
1�<Cough, gasp>...
1�Ack! Today is supposed to be the glorious day I go down in history as the conqueror of the Garlaige Citadel!
1�Hmph, looks like it's back to the drawing board...Enjoy your victory while you can, filthy Elvaan, for it will be short-lived!
1�Fools! You're all very well aware of our army's supplies shortage...
1�Yet you go against my specific instructions and apply the gas to areas where provisions are stored!
1�Vailanice. A great many things have happened in my absence, it seems.

1�The Voidwatch is a fellowship of men and women come together to defend the world from extradimensional invaders called ??Voidwalkers.?? Driven only by an insatiable appetite for destruction, these fell horrors roam the space between dimensions, ever seeking to enter and plunge Vana'diel into chaos.

1�Faced with the risk of mass invasion, Voidwatch leaders devised a strategy wherein potential threats are preemptively neutralized.This act was made possible through the discovery of voidstones, magicked objects capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible to be summarily dispatched.
1�Such efforts to stem the rise of Voidwalkers, collectively dubbed ??Voidwatch Operations,?? or ??Ops?? for short, take place in the vicinity of planar rifts--weak points in the fabric of space.

1�A single person may initiate a Voidwatch operation, at which time ??Voidwatcher?? status will be bestowed upon all qualifying party and alliance members, allowing them to commence battle with the target Voidwalker.

1�Voidwatch Ops are subject to a time limit. Exceed this limit and Voidwatcher status will be revoked for all involved, bringing the confrontation to an end. Individuals straying too far from the site of battle, too, will find themselves relieved of the status.

1�Know also that those who take on the burden of the Voidwatcher become temporarily isolated and unable to receive aid from the outside world.Such is the arduous nature of transdimensional encounters.
1�Initiating a Voidwatch operation requires a voidstone, as well as a stratum abyssite attuned to a particular planar rift.
1�Only one person needs to be in possession of these objects for all party and alliance members to participate.
1�However, there exists a number of participation conditions that must be observed.

1�When an operation commences, a single voidstone will be expended for all who possess it.These combatants will have the opportunity to improve their spoils by manipulating spectral alignment values during battle.
1�Conversely, those not possessing their own voidstone will be limited in the spoils they can obtain.
1�The ??voidstone?? is a magicked object which, when coupled with stratum abyssite, is capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible.

1�Only a single combatant need possess a voidstone to allow all party and alliance members to participate in a Voidwatch operation.Those without one, however, will find their spoils limited in both quantity and quality.
1�As a single voidstone is automatically expended when the battle commences, it is recommended that you keep stock of your inventory.
1�Those wishing to obtain the stones should speak to a Voidwatch officer, who is charged with issuing a set quantity at fixed intervals.
1�Stratum abyssite are dynamic stones capable of evolution. By absorbing the energies emitted by felled Voidwalkers, they become attuned with other planar rifts.
1�After defeating your quarry, present your stone to an atmacite refiner--specialists in the study of otherworld geology--to have its properties determined.
1�Stratum abyssite growth occurs independently of voidstones, and the latter is not required to trigger development.

1�Each dimension is composed of its own existential spectrum to which objects of that world are aligned. The act of rendering a Voidwalker visible is essentially an act of aligning oneself to its existential spectrum.

1�While Voidwatchers are able to, for all practical purposes, interact with such creatures, they in fact fall short of full alignment. Symptoms of this imperfect state can be observed in the limited quantity and quality of spoils normally yielded by Voidwalkers.

1�Compensating measures, however, exist which allow combatants to more closely attune themselves with their extradimensional foe. One such method involves the use of alignment-enhancing artifacts known as ??ascent items.??
1�Alignment values raised through ascent items will remain in place until such time as a riftworn pyxis is opened at the end of a successful operation.
1�Those participating in Voidwatch Ops are recommended to plan ahead in order to make effective use of ascent items.
1�Alignment values can also be raised in the midst of battle by striking at enemy weaknesses, causing their existential attunement to shift to your advantage.

1�Blows can be dealt with abilities such as weapon skills and magic spells, and your choice of weakness and the manner in which you strike it will determine which hue of the alignment spectrum is affected.
1�The existential spectrum is comprised of five lights (blue, red, yellow, green, and white), each of which influences reward yield.
1�The precise workings of each light can be reviewed when examining your current alignment values.
1�Upon the successful conclusion of battle, the alignment bonus as granted by ascent items and the exploitation of enemy weaknesses are combined to determine the spoils.

1�Be forewarned: Voidwalkers are highly guileful beings and will not suffer the same weakness being struck twice. Combatants must be on constant watch for any changes that may occur during the course of battle.
1�Atmacite is the physical agglomeration of a monster's soul, and a vessel for its feral instincts.By infusing atmacite to one's body using 6????, it is possible to enhance one's battle prowess.
1�Be aware, however, that powers granted by atmacite can be tapped only when engaged in a Voidwatch operation.
1�Atmacite is resilient and will not be expended in the infusion process.
1�Furthermore, infused atmacite will remain in place until voluntarily purged.
1�As the configuration of atmacite is not possible during an operation, be sure to see to your battle preparations ahead of time.
1�Cruor can be used to enrich atmacite, enhancing its potency. The amount of cruor required for enrichment and the resultant properties vary with atmacite.

1�Atmacite can be enriched in stages to a maximum of level 
�.
1�All Voidwatchers are urged to make atmacite enrichment a priority, for they might just mean the difference between life and death.
1�Periapt are lucky charms that grant myriad beneficial effects ranging from improved vitality to general upturns in fortune.
1�Especially sought after are those bestowing temporary items at the commencement of an operation, granting combatants a distinct advantage against the enemy.
1�Although their acquisition can only be described as arduous, the benefits make them well worth the effort.

1�Read up on what?Nothing for now.Voidwatch Ops.How to participate.?5????.Stratum abyssite.Alignment.Atmacite.Periapt.

1�The Voidwatch is a fellowship of men and women come together to defend the world from extradimensional invaders called ??Voidwalkers.?? Driven only by an insatiable appetite for destruction, these fell horrors roam the space between dimensions, ever seeking to enter and plunge Vana'diel into chaos.

1�Faced with the risk of mass invasion, Voidwatch leaders devised a strategy wherein potential threats are preemptively neutralized.This act was made possible through the discovery of voidstones, magicked objects capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible to be summarily dispatched.
1�Such efforts to stem the rise of Voidwalkers, collectively dubbed ??Voidwatch Operations,?? or ??Ops?? for short, take place in the vicinity of planar rifts--weak points in the fabric of space.

1�A single person may initiate a Voidwatch operation, at which time ??Voidwatcher?? status will be bestowed upon all qualifying party and alliance members, allowing them to commence battle with the target Voidwalker.

1�Voidwatch Ops are subject to a time limit. Exceed this limit and Voidwatcher status will be revoked for all involved, bringing the confrontation to an end. Individuals straying too far from the site of battle, too, will find themselves relieved of the status.

1�Know also that those who take on the burden of the Voidwatcher become temporarily isolated and unable to receive aid from the outside world.Such is the arduous nature of transdimensional encounters.
1�Initiating a Voidwatch operation requires a voidstone, as well as a stratum abyssite attuned to a particular planar rift.
1�Only one person needs to be in possession of these objects for all party and alliance members to participate.
1�However, there exists a number of participation conditions that must be observed.

1�When an operation commences, a single voidstone will be expended for all who possess it.These combatants will have the opportunity to improve their spoils by manipulating spectral alignment values during battle.
1�Conversely, those not possessing their own voidstone will be limited in the spoils they can obtain.
1�The ??voidstone?? is a magicked object which, when coupled with stratum abyssite, is capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible.

1�Only a single combatant need possess a voidstone to allow all party and alliance members to participate in a Voidwatch operation.Those without one, however, will find their spoils limited in both quantity and quality.
1�As a single voidstone is automatically expended when the battle commences, it is recommended that you keep stock of your inventory.
1�Those wishing to obtain the stones should speak to a Voidwatch officer, who is charged with issuing a set quantity at fixed intervals.
1�Stratum abyssite are dynamic stones capable of evolution. By absorbing the energies emitted by felled Voidwalkers, they become attuned with other planar rifts.
1�After defeating your quarry, present your stone to an atmacite refiner--specialists in the study of otherworld geology--to have its properties determined.
1�Stratum abyssite growth occurs independently of voidstones, and the latter is not required to trigger development.

1�Each dimension is composed of its own existential spectrum to which objects of that world are aligned. The act of rendering a Voidwalker visible is essentially an act of aligning oneself to its existential spectrum.

1�While Voidwatchers are able to, for all practical purposes, interact with such creatures, they in fact fall short of full alignment. Symptoms of this imperfect state can be observed in the limited quantity and quality of spoils normally yielded by Voidwalkers.

1�Compensating measures, however, exist which allow combatants to more closely attune themselves with their extradimensional foe. One such method involves the use of alignment-enhancing artifacts known as ??ascent items.??
1�Alignment values raised through ascent items will remain in place until such time as a riftworn pyxis is opened at the end of a successful operation.
1�Those participating in Voidwatch Ops are recommended to plan ahead in order to make effective use of ascent items.
1�Alignment values can also be raised in the midst of battle by striking at enemy weaknesses, causing their existential attunement to shift to your advantage.

1�Blows can be dealt with abilities such as weapon skills and magic spells, and your choice of weakness and the manner in which you strike it will determine which hue of the alignment spectrum is affected.
1�The existential spectrum is comprised of five lights (blue, red, yellow, green, and white), each of which influences reward yield.
1�The precise workings of each light can be reviewed when examining your current alignment values.
1�Upon the successful conclusion of battle, the alignment bonus as granted by ascent items and the exploitation of enemy weaknesses are combined to determine the spoils.

1�Be forewarned: Voidwalkers are highly guileful beings and will not suffer the same weakness being struck twice. Combatants must be on constant watch for any changes that may occur during the course of battle.
1�Atmacite is the physical agglomeration of a monster's soul, and a vessel for its feral instincts.By infusing atmacite to one's body using 6????, it is possible to enhance one's battle prowess.
1�Be aware, however, that powers granted by atmacite can be tapped only when engaged in a Voidwatch operation.
1�Atmacite is resilient and will not be expended in the infusion process.
1�Furthermore, infused atmacite will remain in place until voluntarily purged.
1�As the configuration of atmacite is not possible during an operation, be sure to see to your battle preparations ahead of time.
1�Cruor can be used to enrich atmacite, enhancing its potency. The amount of cruor required for enrichment and the resultant properties vary with atmacite.

1�Atmacite can be enriched in stages to a maximum of level 
�.
1�All Voidwatchers are urged to make atmacite enrichment a priority, for they might just mean the difference between life and death.
1�Periapt are lucky charms that grant myriad beneficial effects ranging from improved vitality to general upturns in fortune.
1�Especially sought after are those bestowing temporary items at the commencement of an operation, granting combatants a distinct advantage against the enemy.
1�Although their acquisition can only be described as arduous, the benefits make them well worth the effort.
